stage.welcome_msg:
Welcome to Round 2.
Same instructions as prior apply.
But this time, you will have more than one possible answer for each question.

choose.q: What numbers can be represented as an unsigned, 8-bit integer?
Examples of secondary storage technology include:
"Big Blue" is a nickname attached to which IT-related company/s
What does EE in Java EE stand for?
In computer graphics, this refers to applying a 2D image to a surface of a shape or polygon on a 3D model.
What does TCP (as in TCP/IP) stand for?
Who invented the first mouse prototype at the Stanford Research Institute in 1963?
Which of the following lighting techniques in 3D computer graphics do NOT support specular highlighting?
Which of the following fall under the necessary conditions for a deadlock?
choose.choice: There is a resource that cannot be used by more than one process at a time.
Processes already holding resources may request for new resources.
Two or more processes form a circular chain where each process waits for a resource that the next process holds.
Held resources can be forcibly removed even if the relevant process is not done with them.

choose.q: The Linux kernel was initially conceived and created in 1991 by:
In computer science, which problem deals with a process adding data to and another process removing data from a fixed-size buffer?
In 3D computer graphics, this type of light source lights all objects within a scene equally.
Which of the following is NOT part of the initial set of ?general purpose domains? defined by RFC 920 in October 1984?
This is an Intel-proprietary technology that improves parallelization of computations by having the operating system address two virtual processors for each processor core that is physically present.
